===Etymology===
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=いげた|井|tr1=i|t1=well, as in a water source|桁|tr2=keta|t2=beam, girder}}, from the way that four [[stout]] [[wooden]] [[beam]]s would be crossed to form the top of a [[wellhead]], similar in shape to a [[tic-tac-toe]] board.

{{rendaku2|sort=いげた|keta|geta}}

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|yomi=kun|acc=1|acc2=0|acc_ref=DJR,NHK|いげた}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|いげた|hhira=ゐげた}}

# a [[puteal]]: a [[wellhead]] for a [[water]] [[well]], traditionally consisting of a [[wooden]] [[enclosure]] framed along the top, and possibly bottom, with [[stout]] wooden [[beam]]s crossed at the ends
# the symbols {{unsupported|#}}, [[＃]], or [[♯]]
# a pattern similar to the symbol #, such as the shape of the crossed [[beam]]s on a beam or [[coffered]] [[ceiling]]
# a kind of {{m|ja|家紋|tr=kamon||family seal}} featuring such a symbol
# the number {{m|en|four}} in the [[argot]] of [[fishmonger]]s
#: Possibly from the way that the character {{m|ja|井}} has four strokes, and the way that {{m|ja|桁|tr=keta}} also means {{m|en|digit}}.
# an advanced [[remodel]]ling [[technique]] for the [[chassis]] of a [[w:Mini_4WD|miniature four-wheel-drive racing model]], consisting of a [[reinforcement]] similar in shape to a traditional Japanese wellhead

===Proper noun===
{{ja-pos|いげた|proper|hhira=ゐげた}}

# {{surname|lang=ja|sort=いげた|A=a|nodot=1}}
